title: Has Iga Swiatek just turned her season around?
description: Why Iga Swiatek's fourth-round win over Elena Rybakina at the French Open could be absolutely pivotal.
author: Simon Cambers

title: The Americans still playing at the 2025 French Open
description: American star Coco Gauff and newcomer Hailey Baptiste are still in the draw at the French Open -- but who else is? We break it down.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: French Open 2025 Day Eight Recap
description: The second Sunday of Roland Garros 2025 delivered another batch of high-quality matches, as the menâ€™s singles draw narrowed to its final eight. Lorenzo Musetti continued his strong clay form with a composed win over Holger Rune under the lights, Carlos Alcaraz notched his 100th tour-level clay victory in a thrilling four-set battle against Ben â€¦
author: Jonathan

title: French Open 2025 Day Seven Recap
description: The business end of the French Open is fast approaching, and Day Seven served up a relatively straightforward batch of matches, with only one encounter going more than three sets. Jannik Sinner delivered the performance of the day with a clinical dismantling of Jiri Lehecka, while Novak Djokovic quietly picked up his 99th win at â€¦
author: Jonathan

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Letâ€™s take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: What is the Roland Garros tennis schedule?
description: Roland Garros continues on Monday in Paris, where the final fourth-round matches will be played. World No. 1 Jannik Sinner and three-time champion Novak Djokovic are among the stars who will try to earn a quarter-final spot. View the full order of play for MondayÂ here and see featured matches below. Court Philippe-Chatrier From 11 a.m. [2] Coco Gauff vs. [20] Ekaterina Alexandrova [3] Jessica Pegula vs. Lois Boisson [6] Novak Djokovic vs. Cameron NorrieÂ  Night Session Not before 8:15 p.m. [1] Jannik Sinner vs. [17] Andrey Rublev Court Suzanne-Lenglen From 11 a.m. [6] Mirra Andreeva vs. [17] Daria Kasaktina [3] Alexander Zverev vs. Tallon Griekspoor [7] Madison Keys vs. Hailey Baptiste [5] Jack Draper vs. Alexander Bublik View Full Order Of Play Here [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Musetti downs Rune for first Top 10 major win; Tiafoe makes more U.S. history
description: Lorenzo Musetti notched the first Top 10 win of his Grand Slam career with a measured performance Sunday night at Roland Garros. The Italian wore down 10th seed Holger Rune after a competitive start and advanced to his second major quarter-final with a 7-5, 3-6, 6-3, 6-2 victory. In the first match of the fortnight between Top 10 players in the PIF ATP Rankings, World No. 7 Musetti dominated the final two sets to earn his first Lexus ATP Head2Head win in three tries against Rune. As the steady Italian asserted his superiority in the rallies on Court Philippe-Chatrier, Rune adopted an aggressive game plan with frequent net charges but could not prevent the Italian from closing out the win in three hours, 18 minutes. Musetti will bid to match his Wimbledon semi-final run from last year when he takes on Frances Tiafoe, who has yet to drop a set in the tournament. A dramatic close to the opening set saw the players trade breaks from 5-4, with Musetti serving out the set at the second time of asking. Rune answered well to level in set two but could not match his opponent in the rallies as the match wore on. The 10th Italian man to reach the Roland Garros quarters in the Open Era, Musetti could meet countryman and World No. 1 Jannik Sinner in the final. MAGNIFIQUE FROM MUSETTI ðŸ”¥ He overcomes Rune 7-5 3-6 6-3 6-2 to cement his spot in the QFs ðŸŒŸ#rolandgarros #musetti pic.twitter.com/62lOnZnkGG â€” ATP Tour (@atptour) June 1, 2025 Tiafoe is also through to his first Roland Garros quarter-final after a 6-3, 6-4, 7-6(4) result against unseeded German Daniel Altmaier. The American's four wins this fortnight equal his win total in nine previous main-draw appearances at the clay-court major. He is the first American to reach the Roland Garros quarters without losing a set since Andre Agassi in 1995. He is joined by Tommy Paul in the quarters, marking the first time the U.S. has had two men in that stage since 1996. Tiafoe's win was a measure of revenge for his friend and countryman Taylor Fritz, after Altmaier knocked out the fourth seed in the opening round. He won 30 of 37 net points in the victory, according to Infosys Stats. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: 'Are you getting ready for UFC?' How super-fit Draper intimidates Bublik
description: Jack Draper's rise up the rankings has been "insane", says Alexander Bublik - who wonders how he can beat him in the French Open fourth round.

title: 'I fought myself in the mind' - Alcaraz beats Shelton to reach quarters
description: Defending champion Carlos Alcaraz is through to the French Open quarter-finals after a four-set win over American Ben Shelton.
